page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY
page.content: The area lies to the southwest of Glasgow straddling the Ayr-Renfrew county border and consists of gently rolling farmland crisscrossed by small streams.Patches of mainly deciduous woodland add interest to the scene.The one steep hillside borders the northern shore of Loch Libo,a nature reserve,rising to 259m at Corkindale Law which offers a panoramic view of the surrounding countryside. The only centre of population is the commuter village of Uplawmoor to the southeast of the A736 Glasgow to Irvine road.However newly-built bungalows may be seen along many of the sideroads which serve the farms. A constant stream of commuter and commercial traffic moves along the A736 which runs parallel to the less busy railway line to the coast.
